TECHFRAG.Name: TECH_FRAGMENT_NAME
TECHFRAG.Subtitle: TECH_FRAGMENT_SUBTITLE
TECHFRAG.Description_Text:
A dense miasma of <TECHNOLOGY>Nanites<>, undulating in its potentiality. These clusters are stable, but unrestricted nanite foam can produce undesirable runaway reactions in the presence of organic matter.

Used in the construction of advanced technologies. Highly valuable to specialist traders.

ASTEROID2.Name: UI_ASTEROID2_NAME
ASTEROID2.Subtitle: UI_ASTERIOID_SUB
ASTEROID2.Description_Text:
Highly valuable interstellar trading mineral, typically <COMMODITY>mined from asteroids<>. Occasionally found in underground planetary deposits.

Universally prized for its beauty and versatility.

SPACEGUNK4.Name: UI_MAINTAIN_SUB4_NAME
SPACEGUNK4.Subtitle: UI_MAINTAIN_SUB_SUB
SPACEGUNK4.Description_Text:
A heavy, oozing slime. It is moving gently, as if it has a heartbeat of its own.

Nutrient source: <FUEL>unknown<>.

CATALYST2.Name: UI_NEWCATA2_NAME
CATALYST2.Subtitle: UI_CATALYST2_SUB
CATALYST2.Description_Text:
An <CATALYST>advanced catalyst<>, useful for charging <COMMODITY>defensive technologies<> such as shields or hazard protection.
 
Created in a <TECHNOLOGY>Refiner<>, or occasionally found in crystalline form on a planet's surface.

Offers a substantially improved energy-per-gram ratio over regular Sodium.

FUEL2.Name: UI_FUEL_2_NAME
FUEL2.Subtitle: UI_FUEL2_SUB
FUEL2.Description_Text:
Advanced material, processed from regular <FUEL>carbon<> in a <TECHNOLOGY>Refiner<>.

The increased molecule density offers a substantially improved energy-per-gram ratio.

Occasionally found in crystalline form. Harvesting large crystals may require a <TECHNOLOGY>Advanced Mining Laser<>.

FARMPROD3.Name: UI_FARMPROD_3_NAME
FARMPROD3.Subtitle: UI_FARMPROD_SUBTITLE
FARMPROD3.Description_Text:
Shatter-proof, scratch-resistant glass with a self-cleaning, UV-cured coating, for general construction use.

Refined from <STELLAR>Silicate<> powder. Extract silicate from the earth with a <TECHNOLOGY>Terrain Manipulator<>.

Can be crafted from <TECHNOLOGY>Frost Crystals<> extracted from plants on <TECHNOLOGY>frozen<> worlds.

DUSTY1.Name: UI_DUSTY1_NAME
DUSTY1.Subtitle: UI_BIOME_SUB
DUSTY1.Description_Text:
Local mineral extract, typically found in large deposits or extracted from common minerals after inspection with an <TECHNOLOGY>Analysis Visor<>.

Typically found on planets with a <FUEL>desert environment<>.

PLANT_POOP.Name: UI_PLANTSUB_CREATUREPOOP_NAME
PLANT_POOP.Subtitle: UI_PLANTSUB_SUBTITLE
PLANT_POOP.Description_Text:
A foul-smelling compound that can be harvested from the <TRADEABLE>Gutrot Flower<>, or less desirably from the faecal matter of some species.

Creatures can be fed to encourage the formation and deposition of faecium crystals.

FUEL1.Name: UI_FUEL_1_NAME
FUEL1.Subtitle: UI_FUEL1_SUB
FUEL1.Description_Text:
The building block of all organic life. Of critical importance to space travellers, as Carbon is used to <FUEL>recharge mining equipment<>.
 
The <TECHNOLOGY>Mining Laser<> will harvest Carbon from trees, plants, and all other forms of vegetable.

JELLY.Name: FUEL_JELLY_NAME
JELLY.Subtitle: FUELGEL_SUB
JELLY.Description_Text:
A faintly-glowing jelly. Its gentle light and soft wobble belie the fact that this sticky gel is both highly toxic and highly flammable. Skin contact is to be avoided at all costs.

Synthesised from <TECHNOLOGY>Di-hydrogen<>.

LAUNCHSUB.Name: UI_LAUNCHSUB_NAME
LAUNCHSUB.Subtitle: UI_LAUNCHSUB_SUB
LAUNCHSUB.Description_Text:
A stable, crystalline form of hydrogen remarkable both for its extreme energy density and its stability at atmospheric pressures.

Common to all worlds, Di-hydrogen is found in the form of large <TECHNOLOGY>blue crystals<>. It is a key component of <COMMODITY>Starship Launch Fuel<>.

CAVE2.Name: UI_CAVE2_NAME
CAVE2.Subtitle: UI_CAVE2_SUB
CAVE2.Description_Text:
A highly energised form of <TECHNOLOGY>Cobalt<>, this processed metal can be used to create <COMMODITY>Advanced Ion Batteries<>, a conveniently portable source of energy for the <TECHNOLOGY>Exosuit<>.

In widespread use as a key component in the creation of <TECHNOLOGY>advanced technologies and structures<>.

CAVE1.Name: UI_CAVE1_NAME
CAVE1.Subtitle: UI_CAVE1_SUB
CAVE1.Description_Text:
Mined from <TECHNOLOGY>underground minerals<>, cobalt is found in plentiful supply in caves and caverns. Useful in the manufacture of <COMMODITY>Ion Batteries<>.

It is used in the creation of several technologies and structures, and can be processed in a <TECHNOLOGY>Refiner<> to make the most of its inherent charge.

CATALYST1.Name: UI_WATER2_NAME
CATALYST1.Subtitle: UI_CATALYST1_SUB
CATALYST1.Description_Text:
A powerful <CATALYST>catalyst<>, useful for charging <COMMODITY>defensive technologies<> such as shields or hazard protection.
 
Exosuit material handling technology allows automatic harvesting from appropriate <CATALYST<>sodium-rich flora<>.

A vital ingredient in the creation of many advanced devices, products and components.

LAND2.Name: UI_LAND2_NAME
LAND2.Subtitle: UI_LAND2_SUB
LAND2.Description_Text:
Processed metal, free of dust and pebbles. Used to construct a wide variety of <EARTH>structures<> and <TECHNOLOGY>technologies<>.

Typically purified from Ferrite dust using a <TECHNOLOGY>Refiner<>, but can occasionally be found in large deposits. Collection may require an <TECHNOLOGY>Advanced Mining Laser<>.

LAND3.Name: UI_LAND3_NAME
LAND3.Subtitle: UI_LAND3_SUB
LAND3.Description_Text:
Highly processed metal, requiring several stages of processing in a <TECHNOLOGY>Refiner<>.

Used in the creation of advanced structures and technologies. Avoid ingestion.

STELLAR2.Name: UI_STELLAR2_NAME
STELLAR2.Subtitle: UI_STELLAR_SUB
STELLAR2.Description_Text:
A processed metal alloy, created in a <TECHNOLOGY>Refiner<> from the <STELLAR>stellar metals<>: <COMMODITY>Copper<>, <FUEL>Cadmium<>, <TRADEABLE>Emeril<> and <TECHNOLOGY>Indium<>.

The <SPECIAL>rarer<> the stellar metal, the more Chromatic Metal it will produce.

This valuable metal is used in the creation of many <TECHNOLOGY>advanced technologies<>.

LAND1.Name: UI_LAND1_NAME
LAND1.Subtitle: UI_LAND1_SUB
LAND1.Description_Text:
An abundant mineral element, found in <EARTH>rock formations<> and other areas of geological interest. Easily extracted using a <TECHNOLOGY>Mining Laser<>.

Typically requires processing in a <TECHNOLOGY>Refiner<> before use in construction or technology manufacture.

WATER2.Name: UI_NEWWATER2_NAME
WATER2.Subtitle: UI_WATER2_SUB
WATER2.Description_Text:
A reactive element most easily harvested by processing the salt-infused minerals found in <TECHNOLOGY>oceans<>.

Used in the manufacture of advanced technologies.

WATER1.Name: UI_WATER1_NAME
WATER1.Subtitle: UI_WATER1_SUB
WATER1.Description_Text:
A naturally occuring salt, found in abundance in <TECHNOLOGY>underwater minerals<>.

Can be processed in a <TECHNOLOGY>Refiner<> to create <TRADEABLE>Chlorine<>. This refined form is used in the manufacture of advanced products and technologies.

GAS2.Name: UI_GAS_2_NAME
GAS2.Subtitle: UI_GAS_SUBTITLE
GAS2.Description_Text:
A colourless, odourless <TRADEABLE>gas<> with a relatively short half-life. 

Found in both <COMMODITY>Radioactive<> and <TECHNOLOGY>Frozen<> atmospheres, this gas is produced by the decay of other high-energy elements.

GAS3.Name: UI_GAS_3_NAME
GAS3.Subtitle: UI_GAS_SUBTITLE
GAS3.Description_Text:
A reactive atmospheric <TRADEABLE>gas<> found wherever there is organic life.

Nitrogen is readily harvested from the atmospheres of <TRADEABLE>Lush<> and <TRADEABLE>Toxic<> planets.

GAS1.Name: UI_GAS_1_NAME
GAS1.Subtitle: UI_GAS_SUBTITLE
GAS1.Description_Text:
A pungent atmospheric <TRADEABLE>gas<>. High concentrations are extremely hazardous to organic life.

With the aid of <TECHNOLOGY>specialised machinery<>, can be extracted from the atmospheres of <FUEL>Scorched<> and <SPECIAL>Desert<> planets.

SPACEGUNK5.Name: UI_MAINTAIN_SUB5_NAME
SPACEGUNK5.Subtitle: UI_MAINTAIN_SUB_SUB
SPACEGUNK5.Description_Text:
An unnaturally thick liquid of dubious colour. Its origins are impossible to fathom.

Appears to have some mild magnetic properties.

SPACEGUNK2.Name: UI_MAINTAIN_SUB2_NAME
SPACEGUNK2.Subtitle: UI_MAINTAIN_SUB_SUB
SPACEGUNK2.Description_Text:
An out of control mould growth that builds up in poorly-maintained machinery.

Likely to be several different species of mould, merged together into one super-colony.

OXYGEN.Name: UI_AIR1_NAME
OXYGEN.Subtitle: UI_AIR_SUB
OXYGEN.Description_Text:
Integral to the atmospheric filtering technology at the heart of the exosuit <FUEL>life support system<>.

Exosuit material processing allows oxygen to be harvested directly from appropriate planetary flora.

Other plantlife may be scanned with the <TECHNOLOGY>Analysis Visor<> to reveal alternative oxygen supplies.

CREATURE1.Name: UI_PLANTSUB_DEADCREATURE_NAME
CREATURE1.Subtitle: UI_HARVESTED_SUB
CREATURE1.Description_Text:
Despite much study, little is known about this haunting, crystalline compound.

It is released from the cadavers of dying creatures, but can also be specifically <TRADEABLE>cultivated<> and harvested from the <SPECIAL>Mordite Root<> plant.

ASTEROID1.Name: UI_ASTEROID1_NAME
ASTEROID1.Subtitle: UI_ASTERIOID_SUB
ASTEROID1.Description_Text:
Valuable interstellar trading mineral, typically <COMMODITY>mined from asteroids<>. Occasionally found in underground planetary deposits.

Prized by people in all systems for its lustre and shine.

ASTEROID3.Name: UI_ASTEROID3_NAME
ASTEROID3.Subtitle: UI_ASTERIOID_SUB
ASTEROID3.Description_Text:
Extremely valuable interstellar trading mineral, typically <COMMODITY>mined from asteroids<>. Occasionally found in underground planetary deposits.

Universally prized for its hardiness and versatility.

PLANT_HOT.Name: UI_PLANTSUB_SCORCHED_NAME
PLANT_HOT.Subtitle: UI_PLANTSUB_SUBTITLE
PLANT_HOT.Description_Text:
A powerful chemical that has resisted attempts at synthesis. It can be harvested from the bark of the <TRADEABLE>Solar Vine<>.

The vine requires a <FUEL>hot climate<> to thrive in the wild, but can be farmed in all environments with the aid of a <TECHNOLOGY>Hydroponics Tray<>.

RADIO1.Name: UI_RADIO1_NAME
RADIO1.Subtitle: UI_BIOME_SUB
RADIO1.Description_Text:
Local mineral extract, typically found in large deposits or extracted from common minerals after inspection with an <TECHNOLOGY>Analysis Visor<>.

Typically found on planets with a <CATALYST>radioactive environment<>.

TOXIC1.Name: UI_TOXIC1_NAME
TOXIC1.Subtitle: UI_BIOME_SUB
TOXIC1.Description_Text:
Local mineral extract, typically found in large deposits or extracted from common minerals after inspection with an <TECHNOLOGY>Analysis Visor<>.

Typically found on planets with a <TRADEABLE>toxic environment<>.

LAUNCHSUB2.Name: UI_LAUNCHSUB2_NAME
LAUNCHSUB2.Subtitle: UI_LAUNCHSUB2_SUB
LAUNCHSUB2.Description_Text:
A stable hydrogen isotope used heavily in both small-scale fusion reactors and neutron-scattering shield technology.

Deuterium very rarely occurs naturally. Most of the galaxy's supply comes from the processing of <TECHNOLOGY>Di-hydrogen<> and <TECHNOLOGY>Tritium<> in <TECHNOLOGY>Refiners<>.

SPACEGUNK3.Name: UI_MAINTAIN_SUB3_NAME
SPACEGUNK3.Subtitle: UI_MAINTAIN_SUB_SUB
SPACEGUNK3.Description_Text:
Handfuls of corroded metal, distorted by years of exposure to the harsh environment.

Handle with care.

COLD1.Name: UI_COLD1_NAME
COLD1.Subtitle: UI_BIOME_SUB
COLD1.Description_Text:
Local mineral extract, typically found in large deposits or extracted from common minerals after inspection with an <TECHNOLOGY>Analysis Visor<>.

Typically found on planets with a <TECHNOLOGY>frozen environment<>.

PLANT_CAVE.Name: UI_PLANTSUB_CAVE_NAME
PLANT_CAVE.Subtitle: UI_PLANTSUB_SUBTITLE
PLANT_CAVE.Description_Text:
A glowing organic bulb, harvested from the <TRADEABLE>Cave Marrow plant<> found growing <TECHNOLOGY>underground<>.

The Cave Marrow has proved resistant to domestication, and no farmable cultivars are known to exist. As such, marrow bulbs must be harvested by hand in the wild.

RED2.Name: UI_RED2_NAME
RED2.Subtitle: UI_RED2_SUB
RED2.Description_Text:
A <STELLAR>chromatic metal<>, generated by fusion in the heart of a star. Such stellar material ends up forming deposits in the crust of local planets.

Cadmium is found on planets orbiting <FUEL>red stars<>, and can be placed in a <TECHNOLOGY>Refiner<> to create purified <STELLAR>Chromatic Metal<> for use in the manufacture of advanced technologies.

BLUE2.Name: UI_BLUE2_NAME
BLUE2.Subtitle: UI_BLUE2_SUB
BLUE2.Description_Text:
A <STELLAR>chromatic metal<>, generated by fusion in the heart of a star. Such stellar material ends up forming deposits in the crust of local planets.

Indium is found on planets orbiting <TECHNOLOGY>blue stars<>, and can be placed in a <TECHNOLOGY>Refiner<> to create purified <STELLAR>Chromatic Metal<> for use in the manufacture of advanced technologies.

GREEN2.Name: UI_GREEN2_NAME
GREEN2.Subtitle: UI_GREEN2_SUB
GREEN2.Description_Text:
A <STELLAR>chromatic metal<>, generated by fusion in the heart of a star.

Emeril is found on planets orbiting <TRADEABLE>green stars<>, and can be placed in a <TECHNOLOGY>Refiner<> to create purified <STELLAR>Chromatic Metal<> for use in the manufacture of advanced technologies.

YELLOW2.Name: UI_YELLOW2_NAME
YELLOW2.Subtitle: UI_YELLOW2_SUB
YELLOW2.Description_Text:
A <STELLAR>chromatic metal<>, generated by fusion in the heart of a star. Such stellar material ends up forming deposits in the crust of local planets.

Copper is found on planets orbiting <CATALYST>yellow stars<>, and can be placed in a <TECHNOLOGY>Refiner<> to create purified <STELLAR>Chromatic Metal<> for use in the manufacture of advanced technologies.

PLANT_LUSH.Name: UI_PLANTSUB_LUSH_NAME
PLANT_LUSH.Subtitle: UI_PLANTSUB_SUBTITLE
PLANT_LUSH.Description_Text:
A beautiful gemstone, this prized product is the engorged, luminescent berry of the <TRADEABLE>Star Bramble<>.

The host plant requires <TRADEABLE>lush conditions<> to thrive in the wild, but can be farmed in all environments with the aid of a <TECHNOLOGY>Hydroponics Tray<>.

PLANT_DUST.Name: UI_PLANTSUB_BARREN_NAME
PLANT_DUST.Subtitle: UI_PLANTSUB_SUBTITLE
PLANT_DUST.Description_Text:
Succulent, edible cactus flesh from the <TRADEABLE>Echinocactus plant<>. As well as being juicy on the tongue, the flesh has many industrial uses.

The Echinocactus thrives only on <FUEL>desert planets<>, but can be farmed in all environments with the aid of a <TECHNOLOGY>Hydroponics Tray<>..

PLANT_TOXIC.Name: UI_PLANTSUB_TOXIC_NAME
PLANT_TOXIC.Subtitle: UI_PLANTSUB_SUBTITLE
PLANT_TOXIC.Description_Text:
An oddly-glowing substance, harvested from the gills of <TRADEABLE>Fungal Clusters<>.

The host plant requires a <TRADEABLE>toxic climate<> to thrive in the wild, but can be farmed in all environments with the aid of a <TECHNOLOGY>Hydroponics Tray<>.

PLANT_RADIO.Name: UI_PLANTSUB_RADIO_NAME
PLANT_RADIO.Subtitle: UI_PLANTSUB_SUBTITLE
PLANT_RADIO.Description_Text:
A strange substance that seems to slowly shift the air around it. It is found in the roots of the <TRADEABLE>Gamma Weed plant<>.

Gamma Weed requires <COMMODITY>high background radiation<> to thrive in the wild, but can be farmed in all environments with the aid of a <TECHNOLOGY>Hydroponics Tray<>.

PLANT_SNOW.Name: UI_PLANTSUB_SNOW_NAME
PLANT_SNOW.Subtitle: UI_PLANTSUB_SUBTITLE
PLANT_SNOW.Description_Text:
A beautiful blue crystal, this organic compound possesses both great hardiness and a shimmering translucence. It is harvested from the leaves of <TRADEABLE>Frostwort<>.

Frostwort requires <TECHNOLOGY>frozen conditions<> to thrive in the wild, but can be farmed in all environments with the aid of a <TECHNOLOGY>Hydroponics Tray<>.

LUSH1.Name: UI_LUSH1_NAME
LUSH1.Subtitle: UI_BIOME_SUB
LUSH1.Description_Text:
Local mineral extract, typically found in large deposits or extracted from common minerals after inspection with an <TECHNOLOGY>Analysis Visor<>.

Typically found on planets with a <TRADEABLE>tropical environment<>.

HOT1.Name: UI_HOT1_NAME
HOT1.Subtitle: UI_BIOME_SUB
HOT1.Description_Text:
Local mineral extract, typically found in large deposits or extracted from common minerals after inspection with an <TECHNOLOGY>Analysis Visor<>.

Typically found on planets with a <FUEL>scorched environment<>.

PLANT_WATER.Name: UI_PLANTSUB_WATER_NAME
PLANT_WATER.Subtitle: UI_PLANTSUB_SUBTITLE
PLANT_WATER.Description_Text:
A rubbery, luminescent sac harvested from <TECHNOLOGY>underwater<> <TRADEABLE>Candle Kelp<> plants.

Agricultural science has not yet tamed the Candle Kelp. As such, these sacs cannot be farmed.

HYPERFUEL1.Name: HYPERFUEL1_NAME
HYPERFUEL1.Subtitle: HYPERFUEL1_SUBTITLE
HYPERFUEL1.Description_Text:
This <FUEL>antimatter-based fuel<> is one of the few power sources capable of meeting the incredible energy requirements of a <TECHNOLOGY>starship hyperdrive<>.

Secured within a robust housing, the cell is guaranteed paradox-free during FTL travel.

GRENFUEL1.Name: GRENFUEL1_NAME
GRENFUEL1.Subtitle: GRENFUEL1_SUBTITLE
GRENFUEL1.Description_Text:
Densely-packed fuel capsule for use in the <TECHNOLOGY>Plasma Launcher<>.
 
Contained highly-pressurised electro-thermal energy for use in land disruption grenade technology.

PRODFUEL2.Name: FUELGEL3_NAME
PRODFUEL2.Subtitle: FUELGEL_SUB
PRODFUEL2.Description_Text:
Emergency <FUEL>life support fuel<>.

Synthesised from <TECHNOLOGY>rocket fuel crystals<> and <FUEL>carbon<>, this gel offers a temporary boost to life support systems. Long-term impact on user's lungs is currently unknown.

LAUNCHFUEL.Name: LAUNCHFUEL_NAME
LAUNCHFUEL.Subtitle: LAUNCHFUEL_SUB
LAUNCHFUEL.Description_Text:
Highly reactive solid-state fuel, required to fuel <TECHNOLOGY>Starship Launch Thrusters<>.

Created from crystallised <TECHNOLOGY>Di-hydrogen<>, found in blue deposits on all worlds.

POWERCELL.Name: POWERCELL_NAME
POWERCELL.Subtitle: POWERPROD_SUB
POWERCELL.Description_Text:
Convenient and optimised power storage unit. Used in a wide variety of <COMMODITY>defensive<> and <COMMODITY>hazard protection<> systems.
 
Constructed by fusing <EARTH>Ferrite Dust<> with underground <TECHNOLOGY>Cobalt<>. Frequently found ready-made in cylindrical metal containers.

ALLOY1.Name: UI_ALLOY_SIMPLE_1_NAME
ALLOY1.Subtitle: UI_ALLOY_SIMPLE_SUBTITLE
ALLOY1.Description_Text:
A lightweight and highly malleable alloy. Crafted from <EARTH>Paraffinium<> and <EARTH>Ionised Cobalt<>.

In high demand on the Galactic Trade Network due to its utility in the construction of planetside outposts and facilities.

ALLOY2.Name: UI_ALLOY_SIMPLE_2_NAME
ALLOY2.Subtitle: UI_ALLOY_SIMPLE_SUBTITLE
ALLOY2.Description_Text:
A popular metal alloy with a wide variety of uses. 'Dirty Bronze' has shed its scientific name in favour of the popular term for its colour.

Crafted from <EARTH>Pure Ferrite<> and <EARTH>Pyrite<>.

ALLOY3.Name: UI_ALLOY_SIMPLE_3_NAME
ALLOY3.Subtitle: UI_ALLOY_SIMPLE_SUBTITLE
ALLOY3.Description_Text:
Combined neutral alloy with uses that range from pharmacology all the way to heavy industry. Crafted from <EARTH>Ionised Cobalt<> and <EARTH>Ammonia<>.

Forms the backbone of galactic alloy trading.

ALLOY4.Name: UI_ALLOY_SIMPLE_4_NAME
ALLOY4.Subtitle: UI_ALLOY_SIMPLE_SUBTITLE
ALLOY4.Description_Text:
Pure Ferrite alloy. Crafted from <EARTH>Pure Ferrite<> and <EARTH>Uranium<>.

Used extensively in starship freighter construction due to its sheer strength. A hardcore material popular on the Galactic Trade Network.

ALLOY5.Name: UI_ALLOY_SIMPLE_5_NAME
ALLOY5.Subtitle: UI_ALLOY_SIMPLE_SUBTITLE
ALLOY5.Description_Text:
Highly prized and lustrous alloy. Popular with traders of all known primary galactic races. Crafted from <EARTH>Ionised Cobalt<> and <EARTH>Phosphorus<>.

Easily recognisable by its bright red glow and strong magnetic field.

ALLOY6.Name: UI_ALLOY_SIMPLE_6_NAME
ALLOY6.Subtitle: UI_ALLOY_SIMPLE_SUBTITLE
ALLOY6.Description_Text:
Soft workable alloy favoured by artisans throughout the known galaxy. Crafted from <EARTH>Ionised Cobalt<> and <EARTH>Dioxite<>.

A popular trading good, with many galactic shipping paths devoted to its sale and transport.

REACTION1.Name: UI_REACTION_1_NAME
REACTION1.Subtitle: UI_REACTION_SUBTITLE
REACTION1.Description_Text:
A refined product, holding the energy potential of heated atmospheric gas in a stable state until required.

Crafted from <TRADEABLE>Sulphurine<> and <FUEL>Condensed Carbon<>.

REACTION2.Name: UI_REACTION_2_NAME
REACTION2.Subtitle: UI_REACTION_SUBTITLE
REACTION2.Description_Text:
A refined product, taking ordinary carbon and boosting it with radioactive energy.

Crafted from <TRADEABLE>Radon<> and <FUEL>Condensed Carbon<>.

REACTION3.Name: UI_REACTION_3_NAME
REACTION3.Subtitle: UI_REACTION_SUBTITLE
REACTION3.Description_Text:
A refined product, this is a powerful organic fertiliser in an easily distributed form.

Crafted from <TRADEABLE>Nitrogen<> and <FUEL>Condensed Carbon<>.

SPACEGUNK1.Name: UI_MAINTAIN_SUB1_NAME
SPACEGUNK1.Subtitle: UI_MAINTAIN_SUB_SUB
SPACEGUNK1.Description_Text:
A pulsating, foul smelling goop that builds up in poorly-maintained machinery.

Skin contact is not advised.

ROBOT1.Name: SUB_DEADDRONE_NAME
ROBOT1.Subtitle: SUB_DEADDRONE_SUBTITLE
ROBOT1.Description_Text:
This oily, unsettling liquid leaks from the circuitry of <SPECIAL>Sentinels<>.

Prized by the <FUEL>Vy'keen<>, Pugneum is thought to share some essential properties with <TECHNOLOGY>Nanites<>. It hums in a sinister fashion upon contact with organic matter.

LAVA1.Name: UI_LAVA1_NAME
LAVA1.Subtitle: UI_BIOME_SUB
LAVA1.Description_Text:
Local mineral extract, typically found in large deposits or extracted from common minerals after inspection with an <TECHNOLOGY>Analysis Visor<>.

Typically found on planets with a <FUEL>volcanic environment<>.

PURPLE2.Name: UI_PURPLE2_NAME
PURPLE2.Subtitle: UI_PURPLE2_SUB
PURPLE2.Description_Text:
A <STELLAR>chromatic mineral<>, generated by fusion in the heart of a star. Such stellar material ends up forming deposits in the crust of local planets.

Quartzite is found on planets orbiting <SPECIAL>purple stars<>, and can be placed in a <TECHNOLOGY>Refiner<> to create purified <STELLAR>Chromatic Metal<> for use in the manufacture of advanced technologies.

WATERWORLD1.Name: UI_WATERWORLD1_NAME
WATERWORLD1.Subtitle: UI_BIOME_SUB
WATERWORLD1.Description_Text:
Local metallic extract, typically found in large deposits or harvested from common mineral formations after inspection with an <TECHNOLOGY>Analysis Visor<>.

Typically found on <TECHNOLOGY>ocean planets<>.

EX_PURPLE.Name: UI_EX_PURPLE_NAME
EX_PURPLE.Subtitle: UI_PURPLE2_SUB
EX_PURPLE.Description_Text:
A <STELLAR>chromatic mineral<>, generated by fusion in the heart of a star.

Quartzite is found on planets orbiting <SPECIAL>purple stars<>, and can be placed in a <TECHNOLOGY>Refiner<> to create purified <STELLAR>Chromatic Metal<>.

This quartzite has been activated by the extreme conditions in which it was formed, and is highly valuable.

GASGIANT1.Name: UI_GASGIANT1_NAME
GASGIANT1.Subtitle: UI_BIOME_SUB
GASGIANT1.Description_Text:
A supercooled chemical extract, typically found in large deposits or extracted from smaller mineral formations after inspection with an <TECHNOLOGY>Analysis Visor<>.

Extracted from deposits formed in the hostile conditions of <SPECIAL>gas giants<>.

GAS4.Name: UI_GAS_4_NAME
GAS4.Subtitle: UI_GAS_SUBTITLE
GAS4.Description_Text:
An atmospheric <TRADEABLE>gas<> found in the hostile conditions of <SPECIAL>gas giants<>.

Methane is readily harvested from equipment deployed on <TECHNOLOGY>gas<> worlds.
